conclusion: Understand the flow of liquid through the baffles to determine which container (E or F) each liquid will flow into.
The baffles are the vertical bars that the liquid flows through.
The liquid flows from A, B, C, and D and needs to be directed into either E or F.
Liquid from A flows through the yellow baffle and then into the green container (E).
Liquid from B flows through the cyan baffle and then into the cyan container (E).
Liquid from C flows through the pink baffle and then into the white container (F).
Liquid from D flows through the blue baffle and then into the white container (F).
Liquid from A and B flows into container E.
Liquid from C and D flows into container F.
The liquid from A and B will flow into container E.
The liquid from C and D will flow into container F.
